alert.note: Alert for Garden; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 31 at 8:59AM CST until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... North Platte River at Lewellen affecting Garden and Keith Counties. For the North Platte River...including Lewellen...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...North Platte River at Lewellen. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Overflow and high water table levels may cause seepage and flooding of basements and crawl spaces near and along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM MST Saturday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fluctuate around 8.0 feet for the next several days. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM MST.
